body:
@minux, c++ references are just const pointers but fake as not in most implementations. 
In fact, maps and channels in Golang are very possibly implemented also like this. (for slices, surely not)

The problem of the go faq is not to choose a proper word to describe the implementation. 
It is how to make a more consistent explanation for map/slice/channel values and other general values.
Again, my opinion is it is unnecessary to choose a word, now "reference value" used in go faq, to make maps/slices/channels as special values.

The more consistent explanation for map/slice/channel values is just describe them as pointer wrappers so that the word "reference value" can be eliminated totally from go faq. By doing this, much confusions can be avoided.

After all, the word "reference" has been removed from go spec long long ago, why not remove it from go faq also?
